title: Phoebe Burgess 'set to move to Bowral' after second split from NRL star husband Sam Burgess
text:
Since news of her split from husband Sam Burgess broke last week, Phoebe Burgess has remained at her parents' home in Bowral with their children.

And now a new report claims that the 30-year-old is moving to the well-to-do Southern Highlands permanently, leaving behind the pair's Maroubra mansion.

A source allegedly told The Daily Telegraph on Saturday: 'It makes sense as Phoebe's support network is in Bowral. She grew up there, her mum and dad are there and her sister Jemima'.

'Her support network is in Bowral': The Daily Telegraph claimed on Saturday that Phoebe Burgess (pictured with her children) is 'set to leave her Maroubra mansion and move to the Southern Highlands' after her 'second split' from NRL star husband Sam Burgess

The source went on to say because the town is close to Sydney, Phoebe and Sam, 30, could continue to co-parent their children, two-year-old daughter Poppy and 10-month-old son Billy.

'It's only an hour away from Sydney so not too hard for Sam to still see the kids and Phoebe to be able to attend events for her clients,' the insider reportedly said.

Daily Mail Australia has reached out to Phoebe Burgess for comment.

It comes after NRL star Sam looked downcast as he left the $3.8 million marital home he shares with his wife Phoebe in Maroubra in Sydney on Thursday, following news the couple have 'split' for good.

A source allegedly told The Daily Telegraph on Saturday: 'It makes sense as Phoebe's support network is in Bowral. She grew up there, her mum and dad are there and her sister Jemima'

Country escape: On Wednesday, Sam's wife Phoebe shared a photo to Instagram of herself and their children, Poppy and Billy, playing in the pantry of her parents' Bowral estate

The South Sydney Rabbitohs player then headed to Bonnie Doon Golf Club with a car boot full of packed bags.

On Wednesday, Sam's wife Phoebe shared a photo to Instagram of herself and their children playing in the pantry of her parents' Bowral estate.

'Even when I hide in the storage room for a minute of peace... they find me,' she joked in the caption.

Last weekend, The Sunday Telegraph reported that Sam and Phoebe had broken up for a second time after initially splitting in December.

Carrying on: The source went on to say because Bowral is close to Sydney, Phoebe and Sam, 30, (left) could continue to co-parent their children, two-year-old daughter Poppy and 10-month-old son Billy

The pair had rekindled their marriage in April, but an insider claimed things 'just didn't work' and Sam 'moved out several weeks ago'.

The source added: 'The most important thing for them is that their children are happy and healthy, that is their priority.'

During their brief separation earlier this year, Sam moved into Anthony Bell's $11.5 million Dover Heights mansion, The Sydney Morning Herald reported.

Neither Sam nor Phoebe has publicly commented on their rumoured split.

On the move? It comes after NRL star Sam looked downcast as he left the $3.8 million marital home he shares with his wife Phoebe in Maroubra, Sydney on Thursday, following news the couple have 'split' for good

In April, Phoebe confirmed to Stellar magazine that she and Sam had reconciled after their initial split in December, but admitted things weren't 'perfect'.

'Every person on this planet who is married knows it isn't perfect. It's never going to be perfect... Sam and I will have good days and we'll have trying days,' she said at the time.

Phoebe added that the reason for their split, and the details of their reconciliation, 'will always and forever just be between Sam and I'.

Final go? In April, Phoebe confirmed to Stellar magazine that she and Sam had reconciled after their initial split in December, but admitted things weren't 'perfect'
description: Since news of her split from husband Sam Burgess broke last week, Phoebe Burgess has remained at her parents' home in Bowral with her children.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
